head.citation-title: 2nd International Conference on Pan-African Intelligence and Smart Systems, PAAISS 2022
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 27 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Pan-African Intelligence and Smart Systems. The topics include: Help in the Early Diagnosis of Liver Cirrhosis Using a Learning Transfer Method; Automatic Detection of COVID-19 Using Ensemble Transfer Learning Based on Lung CT Scans; pancreas Instance Segmentation Using Deep Learning Techniques; automating Sickle Cell Counting Using Object Detection Techniques; quaternionic Wavelets for Estimating Forest Biomass by Gradient Boosting Methods; detection and Classification of Underwater Acoustic Events; plant Diseases Detection and Classification Using Deep Transfer Learning; light-Weight Deep Learning Framework for Automated Remote Sensing Images Classification; deepMalOb: Deep Detection of Obfuscated Android Malware; reinforcement Learning-Based Dynamic Path Allocation in IoT Systems; reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces: Redefining the Entirety of Wireless Communication Systems in Leaps and Bounds; A New Class of DC-Free Run-Length Limited Codes; conversational Pattern Mining Using Motif Detection; facial Expression Recognition with Manifold Learning and Graph Convolutional Network; speech Emotion Classification: A Survey of the State-of-the-Art; forward Obstacle Detection by Unmanned Aerial Vehicles; multi-agent Reinforcement Learning Based Approach for Vehicle Routing Problem; an On-Site Collaborative Approach of Road Crash Data Collection; reduction of Data Transmission in an IoT Wireless Sensor Network; a Comparative Study of Regressors and Stacked Ensemble Model for Daily Temperature Forecasting: A Case Study of Senegal; exploring Use of Machine Learning Regressors for Daily Rainfall Prediction in the Sahel Region: A Case Study of Matam, Senegal; dynamic Pre-trained Models Layer Selection Using Filter-Weights Cosine Similarity; learning Approximate Invariance Requires Far Fewer Data; deep Matrix Factorization for Multi-view Clustering Using Density-Based Preprocessing; Application of Genetic Algorithm for Complexity Metrics-Based Classification of Ontologies with ELECTRE Tri.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social-Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering, LNICST
